abstract: When a hotly contested $39 billion takeover like AT&T’s proposed purchase of T-Mobile USA falls apart, plenty of parties will have something to say. DealBook has compiled responses to AT&T’s decision to drop its bid.
snippet: When a hotly contested $39 billion takeover like AT&T’s proposed purchase of T-Mobile USA falls apart, plenty of parties will have something to say. DealBook has compiled responses to AT&T’s decision to drop its bid.
lead_paragraph: After nine months of AT&T fiercely defending its $39 billion bid for T-Mobile USA in public and in court, the company finally agreed on Monday to end its takeover effort.

headline.main: Reactions to AT&T’s Decision to Cancel Its T-Mobile Deal

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Deutsche Telekom of Germany still faces long-term problems with its American subsidiary, T-Mobile USA, after the proposed $39 billion takeover by AT&T was scrapped on Monday.
snippet: Deutsche Telekom of Germany still faces long-term problems with its American subsidiary, T-Mobile USA, after the proposed $39 billion takeover by AT&T was scrapped on Monday.
lead_paragraph: LONDON — Deutsche Telekom of Germany still faces long-term problems with its American subsidiary, T-Mobile USA, after the proposed $39 billion takeover by AT&T was scrapped on Monday.

AT&T Ends $39 Billion Bid for T-Mobile  |  AT&T on Monday ended its effort to buy T-Mobile USA, acknowledging that it could not overcome stiff opposition by the Obama administration to form the nation’s biggest cellphone service provider.

abstract: AT&T says the breakup fee for ending the T-Mobile USA takeover attempt is $4 billion. Deutsche Telekom values the fee at $6 billion. The difference, it seems, is a matter of accounting.
snippet: AT&T says the breakup fee for ending the T-Mobile USA takeover attempt is $4 billion. Deutsche Telekom values the fee at $6 billion. The difference, it seems, is a matter of accounting.
lead_paragraph: You say “po-TAY-to,” I say “po-TAH-to.” But in the case of the T-Mobile USA deal’s breakup fee, it’s a very big root vegetable.

headline.main: T-Mobile and AT&T: What’s $2 Billion Among Friends?

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced

abstract: Deutsche Telekom could move quickly to seal a new alliance with another American telecommunications operator for T-Mobile USA following the collapse of its planned sale to AT&T, analysts said.
snippet: Deutsche Telekom could move quickly to seal a new alliance with another American telecommunications operator for T-Mobile USA following the collapse of its planned sale to AT&T, analysts said.
lead_paragraph: BERLIN — Deutsche Telekom could move quickly to seal a new alliance with another American telecommunications operator for its T-Mobile USA subsidiary following the collapse of its planned sale to AT&T, analysts said on Tuesday.

headline.main: As Deutsche Telekom Ponders Options, a New Deal Is Expected
